name: Board of psychology; appointment, qualifications, term, expenses
text: §465-4  Board of psychology; appointment, qualifications, term, expenses.  There is created a board of psychology consisting of seven members.  There shall be five members representing varied specialties of the profession, each of whom shall be licensed to practice psychology under this chapter and have a minimum of five years of post-doctoral professional experience, and two lay members from the community at large.  A lay member shall not be a psychologist, an applicant, or former applicant for licensure as a psychologist. [L 1967, c 290, pt of §1; HRS §465-4; am L 1982, c 204, §8; ree L 1983, c 136, §2; am L 1985, c 115, §6; am L 1987, c 72, §1; am L 1992, c 202, §158; ree L 1993, c 322, §15]
